qas.question: In what Italian province was Giovanni Battista Montini born?
In what Italian village was Giovanni Battista Montini born?
What political organization was Giovanni's father a member of?
How many brothers did Giovanni have?
What was Giovanni's mother descended from?

context: Giovanni Battista Montini was born in the village of <a1_0>Concesio<a1_0/>, in the province of <a0_0>Brescia, Lombardy<a0_0/> in 1897. His father Giorgio Montini was a lawyer, journalist, director of the Catholic Action and member of the <a2_0>Italian Parliament<a2_0/>. His mother was Giudetta Alghisi, from a family of <a4_0>rural nobility<a4_0/>. He had <a3_0>two<a3_0/> brothers, Francesco Montini, who became a physician, and Lodovico Montini, who became a lawyer and politician. On 30 September 1897, he was baptized in the name of Giovanni Battista Enrico Antonio Maria Montini. He attended Cesare Arici, a school run by the Jesuits, and in 1916, he received a diploma from Arnaldo da Brescia, a public school in Brescia. His education was often interrupted by bouts of illness.
